body_html:
@asimshankar :
a. Currently, I use bazel ver. 0.3.2
b. I use git branch(git clone -b r.0.11 ... I use) to build from source.
c. describe below.

I followed instruction on the "https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources"

pre-installed : xcode - 7.2, Nvidia webdriver : 346.03.15f02

  1. install pip
  2. git clone -b r.0.11 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
  3. install java
  4. install bazel and swig
  5. install python dependencies(like wheel, numpy, six)
  6. install coreutils & cuda(ver. 8.0.46)
  7. Add Env to bash_profile
  8. about cudnn
  9. configuration
  10. bazel build -c opt --config=cuda ...
  11. bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg

and made an error in 11.(There is no other command inserted between the procedures above.)

Thank you for your help and tell me what you want to know more about my installation procedures and details.

body:
@asimshankar :
a. Currently, I use bazel ver. 0.3.2
b. I use git branch(_git clone -b r.0.11 ..._ I use) to build from source.
c. describe below.

I followed instruction on the "https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/get_started/os_setup.html#installing-from-sources"

pre-installed : xcode - 7.2, Nvidia webdriver : 346.03.15f02
1. install pip
2. git clone -b r.0.11 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
3. install java
4. install bazel and swig
5. install python dependencies(like wheel, numpy, six)
6. install coreutils & cuda(ver. 8.0.46)
7. Add Env to bash_profile
8. about cudnn
9. configuration
10. bazel build -c opt --config=cuda ...
11. bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg

and made an error in 11.(There is no other command inserted between the procedures above.)

Thank you for your help and tell me what you want to know more about my installation procedures and details.
